UserAccount.title: UserAccount
UserAccount.description: Stores user account information. Note: Authentication details (like passwords) are assumed to be managed externally by Firebase Authentication.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserAccount entity.

firebaseUid.description: The unique user ID provided by Firebase Authentication. Used to link the user account in this system to their Firebase Authentication account.

creationTimestamp.description: Timestamp of when the user account was created.

lastLoginTimestamp.description: Timestamp of the user's last login.

definition.description: Stores user account information, keyed by the Firebase UID. This structure ensures path-based ownership and authorization independence.

params.name: uid
params.description: The Firebase UID of the user.  Used for secure access and authorization.

firestore.reasoning:
This design prioritizes simplicity and security for user account management. By storing each user's data under a path directly derived from their Firebase UID (`/users/{uid}`), we achieve path-based ownership, which is the most secure and efficient method. 

Authorization Independence: There is no dependency on parent document data, as each user document stands alone and authorization is solely based on the `request.auth.uid` matching the document ID. This avoids `get()` calls in security rules and enables atomic operations.

QAPs: The structure supports secure `list` operations because access to user data is strictly controlled by the user's UID.  Listing operations on `/users` are prevented at the root level and writes are limited to authenticated users, thereby preventing unauthorized data access.
